From: "Jen D." <jeniff@...>

(OOC: Thanks, Cyberwolf! I'm happy to see someone likes my writing. And hi 
everyone who said hi to me! If my post is weird, please don't be mad. I got 
as good a picture of what's happening as I could, but yan isn't the greatest 
explainer in the world :)

Mantle, followed by Mist, Rubble, Aqua, and Cinder, entered the control room 
of the Element, their ship. The element was a large ship, easily as large as 
the Cybertronian Fire and with more advanced stuff on it. The control room 
was a round room filled with computer equipment. Computer screens and 
keyboards lined the walls all around, taking breaks where the doors were 
placed. There was also a circle of computers in the middle of the room. 
Comfy chairs were placed in front of the computers so that the bots in the 
room wouldn't have sore backs like I do from sitting at the comp too much, 
or anywhere for that matter. Cinder watched Mantle walk up the the main 
computer, which was the biggest of the center computers.

"Cyndro," Mantle looked up at the screen of the main computer. It lit up and 
some info flashed across it, getting ready for any tasts that Mantle might 
give it.

"Hello, Mantle," a friendly male voice replied from the console. Cinder 
smiled. The male voice was Cyndro, the ship's 'brain'. It was an advanced 
control system for the ship, and it had access to everything on the ship. It 
was also sentient, so it provided for good conversation, something that 
Cinder cherished. There weren't too many bots that understood her, and 
Cyndro was one of the few that could. His vast knowledge was a great 
compliment for his sometimes child like personality. Cinder would often 
spend hours sitting in the comfortable chairs and talking to Cyndro, or 
laying in her bed in her quarters and talking to him there. He was all over 
the ship. But Cinder knew that Cyndro could get very serious when in serious 
situations. She had seen him almost take control at a space battle they had 
been in, and he had done very well. A ship with a bunch of pilots couldn't 
compete with a single mind like Cyndro's. "What's up?" Cyndro asked Mantle.

"Are we close enough to the planet to do a scan?" Mantle's voice had a tinge 
of hope in it. The eletors had been waiting to get close enough to the 
planet for a while now. "I think we should see as much as we can before 
landing."

"One step ahead of ya!" Cyndro replied happily, seeming very pleased with 
himself. Cinder smiled. She liked how Cyndro loved to be useful. She 
listened to his next words with true interest, because she had been waiting 
for the report for a while. Her excitement rose rapidly. "I already scanned 
the planet and got the energy signatures of most of the bots there. From 
what I can see, there's a war going on, and from the amount of Maximals in 
the area, the base being attacked is probably Maximal too."

Cinder jumped forward, unable to contain herself any longer. "What about the 
others? Are they there? Are they ok? Which ones are there? Can you get a 
comm.."

Cyndro's well natured laugh interrupted Cinder's babbling. "Don't worry, 
Cinder, my scans have picked up the orignal team there, well some of them. 
And yes, he's definetly with them."

Cinder's cheeks turned even redder than normal as she blused. It seemed that 
everyone knew everything about her these days. She looked to Mantle and then 
stepped back, her spark pounding. There was hope!

"You said there was a battle," Mantle said seriously, taking a seat at the 
main computer and looking at the bottom screen. "How serious is it?"

The bottom screen flashed to life with scanner reports of the planet. "It 
actually looks more like total chaos than battle." Cyndro's voice sounded 
from the bottom screen. "As close as I can tell, there's fighting all over 
the planet. Most of it seems to be involving the Maximals though."

Mantle nodded and stood up, looking over his family. Cinder's spark was 
pounding in her chest, hoping that he'd say what he was going to say. "It 
doesn't look like we have a choice. We'll be going in to help the Maximals."

"YAY!" Cinder's yell surprised everyone in the room. Mantle's eyes widened 
as she threw her arms around him, but she was racing at top speed toward her 
room before he could respond. He chuckled and turned back to the main 
computer.

"Well, Cyndro, lets get to that planet!"

"Consider us there, Mantle!" Cyndro replied happily, going for the 
Cybertronian Fire at full speed.
